thread.title: 2015 Savannah Film Festival kicks off
thread.title_full: 2015 Savannah Film Festival kicks off | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: 2015 Savannah Film Festival kicks off
text:
Photos Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - A Festival staff member holds an umbrella with pretzels during opening night of the Savannah Film Festival. Back | Next Actress Olivia Wilde talks to press on the red carpet at the opening night of the Savannah Film Festival.
Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - Photographers, reporters, and fans alike crowd around the red carpet during the open of the 2015 Savannah Film Festival. Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - A crowd mingles infront of the Trustees Theater during the open of the 2015 Savannah Film Festival. Back | Next Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News - A crowd mingles infront of the Trustees Theater during the open of the 2015 Savannah Film Festival. Back | Next Photos by Josh Galemore/Savannah Morning News
A crowd mingles in front of the Trustees Theater during the opening of the Savannah Film Festival.
By Savannah Morning News
The 18th Savannah Film Festival opened Saturday with a celebrity-filled red carpet event and screenings of new movies “Suffragette” and “Meadowland.”
Actress Olivia Wilde, star of “Meadowland,” received the Spotlight Award. The film’s director, Reed Morano, discussed the film after the screening.
Also in attendance were “Suffragette” director Sarah Gavron and producer Alison Owen.
“This year, we have more films produced and directed by women,” says executive director Danny Filson. “That’s a significant development for the film festival.”
The second annual Docs to Watch Directors Roundtable is at 6 p.m. today, hosted by Scott Feinberg of The Hollywood Reporter with several directors, including Bobcat Goldthwait, participating.
Monday highlights include a screening of “The Diary of A Teenage Girl” with actor Alexander Skarsgard expected to attend for a post-film Q&A. Also up Monday is “Tab Hunter Confidential” with a discussion featuring Tab Hunter and producer Allan Glaser. Closing the night will be an evening with Saoirse Ronan after the screening of her film, “Brooklyn.”
Other honorees for the fest include actor Alfie Allen from “Game of Thrones” and actress/director Meg Ryan.
This year, 118 films are being screened. The festival continues through Oct. 31.
“The heart of the festival is the opportunity to bring these individuals together with our students, to showcase our facilities and get our students jobs,” Filson says.
“These are major contenders for the Academy Award,” he says. “We are honored to be able to screen them.”
LEARN MORE
Read interviews and get the full schedule at www.dosavannah.com . Order tickets at filmfest.scad.edu .
